means: 应受，应得，值得( deserve的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: His exercise books were full of well deserved red ticks.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的练习本上尽是些红钩钩，都是他应得的。

sentence.Network_en: It was hard to say why the man deserved such shabby treatment.
sentence.Network_cn: 真搞不懂为什么这个人就该受到如此不公正的待遇。

sentence.Network_en: Derartu is an outstanding athlete and deserved to win.
sentence.Network_cn: 德拉尔图是位优秀的运动员，赢得比赛也是理所当然。

entry.def: If you say that a person or thing deserves something, you mean that they should have it or receive it because of their actions or qualities.

example.ex: Government officials clearly deserve some of the blame as well...
example.tran: 政府官员显然也应当承担部分责任。

example.ex: They know the sport inside out, and we treat them with the respect they deserve...
example.tran: 他们对这项体育运动了如指掌，我们也给予了他们应有的尊重。

entry.def: If you say that someone got what they deserved, you mean that they deserved the bad thing that happened to them, and you have no sympathy for them.

example.ex: One of them said the two dead joy riders got what they deserved.
example.tran: 他们中的一个人说这两名开偷来的车去兜风的人死得活该。

auth_sentence.content: I think we deserved a bit of luck today.

auth_sentence.content: It was no more than the Welsh lads deserved.
auth_sentence.res_content: It was no more than the Welsh lads deserved.

auth_sentence.content: We got what we deserved - a comprehensive win.
